MNormTest 1.1.0

Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix

Source: R/MNormTest.R
covTest.multi.Rd

Hypothesis testing of multiple multivariate normal population covariance matrices when the population mean is unknown.

Usage

covTest.multi(X, label, alpha = 0.05, full = FALSE)

Arguments

X

The data matrix which is a matrix or data frame.

label

A vector of group labels.

alpha

The significance level. Default is 0.05.

full

A boolean value. Default is FALSE. If TRUE, the full output will be displayed.

Value

If full is FALSE, a list containing the hypothesis, statistics and conclusion will be returned. If full is TRUE, a list containing the hypothesis, sample size, total sample mean, within group mean, within group sample covariance, total sum of squares, within sum of squares, statistics, modify factor, df of Chi2, p value, critical value and conclusion will be returned.

References

Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.88-89.

Author

Xifeng Zhang

Examples

data(iris)
chart <- iris[, 1:4]
species <- iris[, 5]
covTest.multi(chart, species)
#> $Hypothesis
#> [1] "H0: Sigma1 = Sigma2 = ... = Sigmak, k =  3"
#> 
#> $Statistics
#>                  Statistics        Value p.value Critical.Value
#> 1          Likelihood Ratio 3.180759e-33      NA             NA
#> 2 Modified Likelihood Ratio 1.420627e-32      NA             NA
#> 3                         M 1.466632e+02      NA             NA
#> 4                      Chi2 1.409430e+02       0       31.41043
#> 
#> $Conclusion
#> [1] "Reject"
#> 
covTest.multi(chart, species, full = TRUE)
#> $Hypothesis
#> [1] "H0: Sigma1 = Sigma2 = ... = Sigmak, k =  3"
#> 
#> $`Sample Size`
#>     setosa versicolor  virginica 
#>         50         50         50 
#> 
#> $`Total Sample Mean`
#> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width 
#>     5.843333     3.057333     3.758000     1.199333 
#>
